Parmeter.name: SpeedPercentage
Parmeter.description: The percent to multiply the speed setpoints by. Used for speed following.

Parmeter.name: JogZones
Parmeter.description: The JogZones feature is intended to place all motors for the ECC into jog behavior. 0-disable 1-enable

Parmeter.name: FullStatusEnable
Parmeter.description: Enable or disable full percentage status to PLC for each zone.

Parmeter.name: HardBraking
Parmeter.description: Enable the ECC to brake aggressively in order to stop heavy and/or fast packages.

Parmeter.name: PELeadDebounce
Parmeter.description: PE Leading edge debounce in ms.

Parmeter.name: PETrailDebounce
Parmeter.description: PE Trailing edge debounce in ms.

Parmeter.name: PLCParameterPolling
Parmeter.description: Enables or disables parameter polling in EPM mode.(Index 0). Index 1 enables command parameter writing in EPM mode

Parmeter.name: NeighborNode
Parmeter.description: The Network ID of the neighbor node connected at each Connection Point. The index refers to the neighbor Node connected at that CP.

Parmeter.name: NetworkID
Parmeter.description: The node address of the device. It can be set by the LCD or Auto-Addressing.

Parmeter.name: NeighborFlow
Parmeter.description: Configuration of Connected Neighbors, the flow of the neighbors relative to this node, and whether or not communication (CP) exists between the nodes.

Parmeter.name: TrackCtrFlags
Parmeter.description: 0 = disabled 1 = Leading edge of package generates tracking ID message to PLC

Bit.description: This bit dictates whether or not the zone is to start the tracking process. When set, the zone will ASSIGN package IDs. When clear, the zone will look upstream for the package ID.
When set and the leading edge of a package is detected, a Package Leading Edge Message is sent to PLC.
When this is set, the Scanner ID is added to the upper nibble of the package ID.
When this is set, node reports MinGap warnings.
When this is set, node will transmit tracking messages to downstream PLC (only index 0).
When this is set, node will transmit missing package, MUZ and FIFO full errors to PLC.
When this is set, node will transmit transmit unknown package ID messages to PLC.

Parmeter.name: ACCMode
Parmeter.description: 1=TRP, 2=TRA, 6=Dynamic Gap, 7=Pass Through, 16=PLC MRG, 17=SI MRG, 19=1265, 20=PLC GRP RUN, 21=LCL GRP RUN

Parmeter.name: RATMode
Parmeter.description: Index 1 value must be 32 (0x20) for RAT Default Mode, or 35 (0x23) for RAT No-Wait Mode. Index 2 defines the divert management scheme for the RAT. Indeces 3 and 4 are not used.

Bit.description: Index 2 RATTypeHeavy - 1=enables RAT Heavy Mode - 4motors(2TRP, 2TXF) 0=enables RAT Light Mode - 2motors (1TRP, 1TXF)
Index 2 MsPLCDvtReqRetry - When set the RAT will retry all request messages.

Parmeter.name: SWDMode
Parmeter.description: Index 1 value must be = 48 (0x30). Index2 defines the divert management scheme for the SWD. Indeces 3 and 4 aren't used.

Bit.description: Index 2 CartonDistributorEnable - When set, then enable Carton Distributor Logic. When clear, assume PLC is connected for divert responses.
Index 2 NoDestinationChangeAllowed - When set, destination cannot be changed to default port or any available ports. When clear, destination changes are permitted.

Index 2 WaitForDivertResponse - When set and CartonDistributorEnable is off, package destination cannot be written until PLC responds with a destination. Retries are used in this mode configured by DvtRequestRetryTmr.
Index 2 EnableConfirmations - When set and CartonDistributorEnable is off, divert confirmation logic is enabled. Shadow packages will be tracked to CP1 whenever the destinaton is CP3 or CP4.

Parmeter.name: EDMMode
Parmeter.description: 22=PLC Mode (future) 23=IO Mode 24=VFD

Parmeter.name: NumberOfMotorsUsed
Parmeter.description: The number of motors connected to this ECC (1-4)

Parmeter.name: MotorChannelLayout
Parmeter.description: ECC motors can be configured in 2 different layouts.

Parmeter.name: PEExist
Parmeter.description: Configure Photoeye Connection

Parmeter.name: EnableWarnOnEPMFltOut
Parmeter.description: EPM fault output configuration

Range.description: Enable faults only on EPM fault output
Enable faults and warnings on EPM fault output
Enable faults and warnings and EPM heartbeat failure on EPM fault output

Parmeter.name: ConveyorDirection
Parmeter.description: Use the motor cable as the axis to determine the motor direction. Looking at the motor cable, setting ConveyorDirection to 0 will set the motor to rotate clockwise around the motor cable axis. Setting ConveyorDirection to 1 will set the motor to rotate counter clockwise around the motor cable axis. 0 = Clockwise 1 = Counter Clockwise

Parmeter.name: ZoneAccelRamp
Parmeter.description: 10th of m/s2

Parmeter.name: ZoneDecelRamp
Parmeter.description: 10th of m/s2

Parmeter.name: NOPLCAckMsgCounter
Parmeter.description: Debug parameter

Parmeter.name: PELatching
Parmeter.description: Configure PE Latching type

Range.description: VFD Drive (BOS/BOR) with digital AT SPEED output
VFD Drive (BOS/BOR) with Analog Speed Output

Parmeter.name: TrackingDebugInfo
Parmeter.description: This parameter specifies the default path to be taken by any package whose package id is “unknown”.

Parmeter.name: DefaultPkgPath
Parmeter.description: This parameter specifies the default path to be taken by any package whose package id is “unknown”.

Parmeter.name: AuxIn1
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the current value of the AUX inputs (is read-only). Used for debug visibility.

Parmeter.name: AuxIn2
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the current value of the AUX inputs (is read-only). Used for debug visibility.

Parmeter.name: ChainIn
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the current value of the Chain In (is read-only) Used for debug visibility. Refer to the section “Auto-Addressing” for further details.

Parmeter.name: THMFeedback
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the current value of the “Thermistor” – read only. Used for debug visibility.

Parmeter.name: FALFeedback
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the feedback from the Hall Effect Sensor for each of the motors. When this feedback falls outside of an internally defined range a Hall Effect Sensor Fault will be reported. This value is a 0 to 255 scaled value of the actual.

Parmeter.name: CurrentFeedback
Parmeter.description: This parameter exposes the feedback current for each of the motors. When this feedback falls outside of an internally defined range an Over/Under current faultwill be reported. This value is a 0 to 255 scaled value of the actual..

Parmeter.name: PWSFeedback
Parmeter.description: Monitors 48V power

Parmeter.name: MotorTempSwitch
Parmeter.description:
This parameter exposes the current value of motor temperature switch .
Used for debug visibility.

Parmeter.name: PEHealthStatus
Parmeter.description: 0 = not good health 1 = good health

Parmeter.name: AuxOut
Parmeter.description:
Used for debugging purposes.
0 = Auxiliary Output is turned off. 1 = Auxiliary Output is turned on.
Note: DebugOutputEnable Must be ON for this parameter to function

Parmeter.name: BrkOut
Parmeter.description:
Used for debugging purposes.
0 = Brake Output is turned off for this zone. 1 = Brake Output is turned on for this zone.
Note: DebugOutputEnable Must be ON for this parameter to function

Parmeter.name: DebugOutputEnable
Parmeter.description:
Used for debugging purposes.
0 = Disables outputs to be written from parameters AuxOut and BrkOut. Outputs are written from internal logic only. 1 = Enables outputs to be written from parameters AuxOut and BrkOut. The parameters will override the internal logic.

Parmeter.name: InputDebounceOne
Parmeter.description: Input debounce, in ms, associated with inputs 1-4 (EDM only). Use parameter index 0 to write debounce time to inputs 1-4. Use index 1 to write to just input one, etc.

Parmeter.name: InputDebounceTwo
Parmeter.description: Input debounce, in ms, associated with inputs 5-8 (EDM only). Use parameter index 0 to write debounce time to inputs 5-8. Use index 1 to write to just input 5, etc.

Parmeter.name: ScannerID
Parmeter.description: Node at which a scanner resides

Parmeter.name: DVTNeighborNode
Parmeter.description: On the SWD this must define the NetworkID of the EDM Divert Controller which controls the Divert, on EDM this must define the NetworkID for the SWD master.

Parmeter.name: ServoManualOverride
Parmeter.description: Manual Servo override for testing mode

Parmeter.name: NewPkgNoRespThreshold
Parmeter.description: Defines the maximum threshold for outstanding new package (leading edge) without PLC response before fault is declared.

Parmeter.name: AuxOutFromPLC
Parmeter.description: Parameter that allows the PLC to control the outputs of the EDM with in I/O mode. This is bit encoded, each bit of the first nibble represents the corresponding output. Bit 0 = output 1, etc

Parmeter.name: UpstreamNeighbor
Parmeter.description: The node ID of the ECC/EDM that is physically located upstream.

Parmeter.name: DVTConfirmationZone
Parmeter.description: When enabled, it is the ACC Zone that will relay the divert confirmations to the PLC.

Parmeter.name: DVTFeedInZone
Parmeter.description: Enables zone as a divert feed zone

Parmeter.name: HardwareCmdConfig
Parmeter.description: Configure the type of hardware enable if no PLC or EPM is present.

Bit.description: Standalone Enable: Enable standalone system. Enable is equal to the 48V power supply.
EnableAuxIn1: Enable signal comes from Aux In 1
EnableAuxIn2: Enable signal comes from Aux In 2
FaultResetAuxIn1: Fault Reset signal comes from Aux In 1
FaultResetAuxIn2: Fault Reset signal comes from Aux In 2
SuppressFaultsAndWarns: Faults and Warnings will not be sent to a host.
HardwareRTRAuxOutExists: Aux Out 1 is configured for CP2 out RTR.
HardwareRTSAuxOutExists: Aux Out 1 is configured for CP1 out RTS.

Parmeter.name: PowerSupplyConfig
Parmeter.description: Configures the type of motor power supply.

Parmeter.name: DynamicGapType
Parmeter.description: Configure Dynamic gap type. Must also configure RequiredDynamicGap for gapping to properly work.

Parmeter.name: StaticGapType
Parmeter.description: Configure Static gap type. Must also configure RequiredStaticGap for gapping to properly work.

Parmeter.name: InvertInputBank2
Parmeter.description: Allows the user in invert inputs in EPM mode (inputs 5-8)

Parmeter.name: NumberOfNodes
Parmeter.description: Number Of Nodes in a simple system. Used for EPM mode

Parmeter.name: MaxPackageID
Parmeter.description: Max allowable package ID

Parmeter.name: DefaultExitPort
Parmeter.description: Default exit port

Parmeter.name: AuxOut2
Parmeter.description:
Used for debugging purposes.
0 = Auxiliary Output is turned off. 1 = Auxiliary Output is turned on.
Note: DebugOutputEnable Must be ON for this parameter to function

Parmeter.name: EDMAnalogTest
Parmeter.description: Test parameter for manufacturing

Parmeter.name: TrackingMishandleFlags
Parmeter.description: Used for Debugging Purposes Only.

Parmeter.name: JamLength
Parmeter.description: This value is used by the ECC to calculate when a jam should occur. Typical values should be 2-3 times the longest package.

Parmeter.name: EnerManTimeout
Parmeter.description: When the ECC has not seen a product for this elapsed distance, the ECC will shut down into sleep/energy management mode.

Parmeter.name: MinimumSpeed
Parmeter.description: This parameter is only used in dynamic gapping mode. Refer to section “Dynamic Gapping Accumulation” for further details.

Parmeter.name: MaximumSpeed
Parmeter.description: This parameter is only used in dynamic gapping mode. Refer to section “Dynamic Gapping Accumulation” for further details.

Parmeter.name: BrakingSpeed
Parmeter.description: This parameter is only used in dynamic gapping mode. Refer to section “Dynamic Gapping Accumulation” for further details.

Parmeter.name: DvtDecisionPosition
Parmeter.description: In ACC used for DVTFeedInZone. This is the point where the package is tracked into the RAT component. In SWD used for deciding when to go to brake speed for unassinged packages.

Parmeter.name: RTRDelay
Parmeter.description: Delay in ms between when a “Ready to Receive” signal and motion start. Available in all accumulation and transportation modes.

Parmeter.name: MRGSideInductPEClrTime
Parmeter.description: Time in milliseconds the photo eye must be clear before releasing the Side Induct Merge

Parmeter.name: GiveUpGapLength
Parmeter.description: If the calculated gap between parcels is larger than this value the ECC abandon trying to close the gap with the ahead parcel . This parameter is used only when ACCMode is Dynamic Gapping Accumulation (DYN_GAP)

Parmeter.name: FullSetTmr
Parmeter.description: This is the delay counter preset to delay the sending of the Fullness set message to the PLC when managing any of the fullness levels

Parmeter.name: FullClrTmr
Parmeter.description: This is the delay counter preset to delay the sending of the Fullness clear message to the PLC when managing any of the fullness levels

Parmeter.name: AnalogOutputRatio
Parmeter.description: This parameter takes the maximum speed and coverts it to a number between 0 and 255 for the analog voltage to a VFD. If the top speed of a VFD conveyor section is 3000mm/sec then to determine the AnalogOutputRatio, use the following equation: 3000mm/sec * (AnalogOutputRatio*1000) = 255.

Parmeter.name: DvtSettings
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = The division point between large and small packages. Any package lengths measured less than the value are “small” and any greater than the value are “large” Index 2 = If this is set to a value of non-zero this parameter determines the amount of ticks the RAT waits for a package that has been seen on an Induct photo eye to for this package to arrive at the RAT corresponding photo-eye. If the package does not arrive in this amount of ticks the package is removed from the RAT buffer and a divert confirmation with an error code of 'F5' is given to the host. Index 3 = RAT Reset Length - Amount of ticks RAT will run after a reset before setting reset complete flag Index 4 = If this set to a value of non-zero, if a box exits the RAT in less ticks than this parameter , the RAT will fault with an appropriate error message indicating that this condition occurred. This applies to straight –thru diverts such as paths of '1 to 2', '2 to 1', '3 to 4', or '4 to 3' only.

Parmeter.name: DvtTrainValTRPSmPckg
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = Training value for the transportation direction motors (rollers) for the “small” packages. This sets the distance the “small” packages will travel on the transportation motors before beginning to divert Index 2 = 0 = Training Value means dist in mm between trail edge of box and stop point 1= Training Value means center of RAT in mm 2 = Training Value means dst in mm between leading edge box and stop point.

Parmeter.name: DvtTrainValTRPLgPckg
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = Training value for the transportation direction motors (rollers) for the “large” packages. This sets the distance the “large” packages will travel on the transportation motors before beginning to divert. Index 2 = 0 = Training Value means dist in mm between trail edge of box and stop point 1= Training Value means center of RAT in mm 2 = Training Value means dst in mm between leading edge box and stop point.

Parmeter.name: DvtTrainValTXFSmPckg
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = Training value for the transfer direction motors band) for the “small” packages. This sets the distance the “small” packages will travel on the transfer motors before beginning to divert. Index 2 = 0 = Training Value means dist in mm between trail edge of box and stop point 1= Training Value means center of RAT in mm 2 = Training Value means dst in mm between leading edge box and stop point.

Parmeter.name: DvtTrainValTXFLgPckg
Parmeter.description: Training value for the transfer direction motors (rollers) for the “large” packages. This sets the distance the “large” packages will travel on the transfer motors before beginning to divert. Index 2 = 0 = Training Value means dist in mm between trail edge of box and stop point 1= Training Value means center of RAT in mm 2 = Training Value means dst in mm between leading edge box and stop point.

Parmeter.name: MinimumGap
Parmeter.description: This defines the minimum gap length used to detect the minimum gap error. Automatically used in the SWD and min gap detection zones configured by TrackCtrlFlags.

Parmeter.name: SlugBumpDistance
Parmeter.description: The minimum amount of distance in mm the slug belt must run when the upstream photo eye is detected as blocked. Only used in Slug Mode (0x18).

Parmeter.name: SlugCrunchDistance
Parmeter.description: The distance in mm the slug belt will continue to run after the photo eye is blocked. Can be thought of as an accumulation delay in mm. Only used in Slug Mode (0x18).

Parmeter.name: RTRPESetTmr
Parmeter.description: RTR photo eye set timer.

Parmeter.name: RtrPEClreTmr
Parmeter.description: RTR photo eye clear timer

Parmeter.name: RequiredDynamicGap
Parmeter.description: This parameter is only used in dynamic gapping mode. Refer to section “Dynamic Gapping Accumulation” for further details.

Parmeter.name: RequiredStaticGap
Parmeter.description: This parameter is used for static gapping. Refer to section “Traditional Static Gapping Accumulation” for further details.

Parmeter.name: RATBrakingSpeedDelay
Parmeter.description: RAT Braking Speed Delay in mm from RAT entrance. RAT will go to braking speed when diverting after this many millimeters of travel

Parmeter.name: HornDurationTmr
Parmeter.description: The time, in ms, that the horn stays on during a start or fault reset in EPM mode

Parmeter.name: ServoDelayTmr
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = time in ms between trp stop and servo/solenoid up, Index 2 = time in ms between txf exit and servo/solenoid down Index 3 = time in ms between servo/solenoid down command and actual servo/solenoid down(used when entering in the RAT - ensures RAT lift mechanism is all the way down when entering.

Parmeter.name: DvtRequestRetryTmr
Parmeter.description: Used for the SWD when WaitForDivertResponse in SWDMode is set. When configured above 0, divert requests not acked will be retried on a periodic basis. This parameter indicates the time period in ms.

Parmeter.name: TrkEdgeBeginWindow
Parmeter.description: Reduce the ConveyorLength by this value to compare if the leading edge of the package less than the result, if true the package is unexpected.

Parmeter.name: TrkEdgeEndWindow
Parmeter.description: Reduce the ConveyorLength by this value to compare if the leading edge of the package less than the result, if true the package is unexpected.

Parmeter.name: NoPLCAckCounter
Parmeter.description: Number of messages the PLC has not acked.

Parmeter.name: ParametersChecksum
Parmeter.description: This parameter is written to when the device is commanded to recalculate the checksum thru the Command Parameter (bit 4 of Parameter 1). When the Calculate Parameter Checksum Request is set high in Parameter 1, the device will calculate a checksum for the complete parameter table and store the resulting checksum to this parameter. The PLC can read this parameter to check if any parameters have changed.

Parmeter.name: FirmwareChecksum
Parmeter.description: This parameter is written to only on startup of the device. Index 1 is used to store the checksum value of the bootloader code of the firmware. Index 2 is used to store the checksum value of the complete firmware code.

Parmeter.name: HeartBeat
Parmeter.description: Length in time between heart beat messages sent to the downstream parameter. If the downstream does not ACK the heart beat then the zone sets a Downstream Heartbeat Failure warning. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the heart beat functionality.

Parmeter.name: DeviceRunTime
Parmeter.description: Total run time of each zone of ECC in hours.

Parmeter.name: ProductCount
Parmeter.description: Count of Total product seen by any configured photo eye in the ECC

Parmeter.name: DvtStatusFlags
Parmeter.description: Count of Total product seen by any configured photo eye in the ECC

Parmeter.name: OutputVoltage
Parmeter.description: Voltage on the EDM analog output

Parmeter.name: HW_FW_Version
Parmeter.description: Index 1 = Version, Index 2 = Device Type, Index 3 = Date, Index 4 = Family Version

Bit.description: CAN Req Buf PLC No Ack
CAN Req Buf ECC No Ack
CAN TX/RX Warning (over95 errors on the bus)
CAN TX bus passive (over 127 TX errors on the bus)
CAN RX bus passive (over 127 RX errors on the bus)
TrackEdge NO Resp Error - no PLC response to Tracking edge message(s)
RAT package showed up at exit too early / SWD_DvtControllerHeartbeatFail

Parmeter.name: ZoneStatusMsgEnable
Parmeter.description: When a bit is set in the following table, a Zone Status Message (refer to Table 30: Peer Status to PLC Message Decode Types) is sent out for the corresponding zone when the status bit changes. The table is used to mask what status bits the PLC will receive on change of state. When a message is sent out, the complete double word value of the ZoneStatus Parameter is sent out in a message to the PLC.

Parmeter.name: PASServoDivertDelay
Parmeter.description: The delay in ms before moving the servo arm to the extend position from the retracted position. Index1 = Servo1, Index2 = Servo2.

Parmeter.name: PASServoRetractDelay
Parmeter.description: The delay in ms before moving the servo arm to the retract position from the extended position. Index1 = Servo1, Index2 = Servo2.

Parmeter.name: DvtJobIOPort
Parmeter.description: This displays the destination output port assigned to relevant package in the package FIFO.Index1=DVTjob[0](first package in FIFO), Index2=DVTjob[1], Index3=DVTjob[2], Index4=DVTjob[3]

Parmeter.name: DvtJobPackageID
Parmeter.description: This displays the package id assigned to relevant package in the package FIFO.

Parmeter.name: DvtProcStatus
Parmeter.description: Index1= incoming_buffer_count_value, Index2=process_counter_value, Index3 = reset_rat_counter_value, Index4=same_counter_value

Parmeter.name: DvtProcPackageID
Parmeter.description: Current Package Index1=Input Port, Index2=package_id, Index3=rat Destination, Index4=rat_dvt_job_index.

Parmeter.name: DvtStatusFlags
Parmeter.description: Count of Total product seen by any configured photo eye in the ECC

Parmeter.name: EDMMode
Parmeter.description: 22=PLC Mode (future) 23=IO Mode 24=VFD
